greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = binomial(2*n, n)^2 / (1-2*n).
comment: Expansion of E(m)/(Pi/2) in powers of m/16 = (k/4)^2, where E(m) is the complete elliptic integral of the second kind evaluated at m. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 04 2003
reference: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, 1964 (and various reprintings), p. 591.
J. M. Borwein and P. B. Borwein, Pi and the AGM, Wiley, 1987, p. 8.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..835
M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
formula: E.g.f.: Sum_{n>=0} a(n) * (x/2)^(2n)/(2n)! = I0^2*(1-2*x^2) +2*x*I0*I1 +2*x^2*I1^2 where I0=BesselI(0, x), I1=BesselI(1, x). - _Michael Somos_, Jun 22 2005
results.author: Joe Keane (jgk(AT)jgk.org)
